title: Deleting a Diffraction Dimension – Real-Time In Situ Visualization via Python
content: Observation of phase transformations or structural damage caused by in-situ stimuli or the electron beam itself are common objectives for in-situ TEM. “Did a phase transformation occur?” is often the first question the data must be used to answer, ideally while still sitting at the microscope. If this is only determined during later detailed data analysis, the user may find that no transformation took place, and they need to redo the experiment, altering the in-situ conditions somehow. Or they may find that the sample was badly damaged during their in-situ experiment, making the results difficult to interpret.
